page.title: 01VIEW OF THE SOUTH HAMS
page.content: This block is part of the South Hams area in South Devon.It is almost entirely made up of fields,bordered by high hedges and banks and laced with tiny lanes (mostly single track) which wind up and down the steep hills and around long-forgotten farm boundaries. The soil here is among the most fertile in England.The farms here are mostly mixed (cows,sheep and crops). The main crops are barley,corn and oats.Much of the population live in fairly isolated farms scattered throughout the block.The main settlements are at Battisborough Cross and at Membland and Collaton Court, these last two in the outskirts of Noss Mayo.Many inhabitants are connected with farming,but increasingly "outsiders" are buying property and commuting to work in Plymouth.
